title: [Self-directed] Simulation-Based Integrated Education Program for Strengthening Pharmaceutical Practice Competencies: Developing Patient-Centered Healthcare Services and Social Responsibility for Public Health Promotion

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pharmaceutical theory, clinical practice experience, healthcare system/patient rights understanding, foundational cultural sensitivity for supporting vulnerable populations
context.additional_context: VR-replicated clinical scenarios and real-world medication dispensing/administration environments. Enhances healthcare service competencies through culturally contextualized patient cases (e.g., multicultural families, economically vulnerable groups). Emphasizes pharmacists' roles in community health promotion.

learning_goals: Learners perform patient symptom analysis and drug interaction assessments in VR simulations with ≥80% accuracy, cultivating medical protocol adherence and social responsibility for public health promotion.

Learners create a personalized learning plan integrating ≥3 theories and practical tasks aligned with constructive alignment principles (goal-assessment-teaching-learning activity linkage), develop two medication management strategies for public health enhancement, and submit deliverables meeting ≥80% of the institution’s checklist.

Learners improve personalized medication treatment planning skills (≥70 points) and medical ethics compliance through ≥3 formative assessments, with a focus on social relationship management to ensure rights of multicultural/vulnerable patients.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
